entry.title: every lesson forms a new scar
entry.summary:
Author: saintsnames

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,615Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: So today, Eddie is angry. It turns white and flaring in the moment that he turns and looks at Tommy, incredulity warring with fury in the hollow of his chest on Buck‚Äôs behalf.‚ÄúYou gave me Ibuprofen?‚Äù Buck asks.His voice is kind of small. Eddie can‚Äôt look at him. But that means that he is looking at Tommy when his face turns‚Äî senselessly‚Äî indignant, his gray eyes flashing in Buck‚Äôs direction. alternate scene from "masks", in which eddie works out what buck's boils are really from.

entry.title: Everyone's Moved On (Help I'm Still at the Restuarant)
entry.summary:
Author: theuniversedoesnotscream

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 60,500Chapters: 13/14Kudos: 312

Summary: ‚ÄúWhy does it feel like you‚Äôre telling me goodbye?‚Äù Eddie whispers, staring into the depths of his husband‚Äôs eyes. ‚ÄúBecause I am‚Äù It‚Äôs meant to be light, a joke but it lands heavier than either of them wants. Because it‚Äôs true. Buck was being drafted again, and as Eddie watches him walk down their walkway, he fears he‚Äôs never going to feel whole again.What happens when a mission goes wrong and a husband loses his partner and their son loses his dad? What happens when someone starts showing interest in Eddie and who on Earth keeps knocking at the door?

entry.title: Where we first met
entry.summary:
Author: Ackorna

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,640Chapters: 45/70Kudos: 82

Summary: Buck never expected the teasing to hurt this much‚Äîbut when it does, it sends shockwaves through the team and his relationship with Eddie. What follows is a journey back to each other: apologies, healing, and a deepening bond forged not through fire, but through family.As they slowly rebuild trust and rediscover what they really mean to each other, Buck, Eddie, and Christopher start shaping a future‚Äîone full of backyard planning, whiteboards, first dances, and the kind of love that feels like home.Because when they finally set the date, it‚Äôs not just a number.It‚Äôs where they first met.

entry.title: Five minutes in heaven
entry.summary:
Author: Ackorna

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,432Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 13

Summary: After years of dancing around their feelings, Buck and Eddie finally get trapped together in an elevator ‚Äî and the moment they‚Äôve been avoiding ignites into something real. What starts as heat and teasing quickly grows into something much deeper as they navigate their feelings, the teasing from the 118, and introducing this new dynamic to Christopher.From late-night conversations and nervous confessions to first arguments and quiet makeups, Buck slowly goes from being a guest in Eddie‚Äôs house to truly belonging there. With Maddie‚Äôs blunt sisterly humor, Carla‚Äôs gentle nudges, Christopher‚Äôs blunt honesty, and the team‚Äôs endless ribbing, the Diaz-Buckley household becomes a place full of warmth, laughter, and family.This is a slow build that becomes a love story ‚Äî about choosing each other, about making a home, and about finally realizing that Buck isn‚Äôt just part of Eddie and Christopher‚Äôs life. He is their life.

entry.title: Words that matter
entry.summary:
Author: Ackorna

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,046Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 32

Summary: When Buck overhears Christopher joking with his friends using homophobic slurs, it breaks his heart in a way he didn‚Äôt expect. Hearing those words from strangers had always hurt ‚Äî but hearing them from the boy who once called him ‚Äúmy other dad‚Äù cuts deeper than anything his parents ever said.Eddie steps in, determined to turn this into a teaching moment instead of just a punishment. With Hen‚Äôs help, Christopher learns why those words hurt and how he can use his sense of humor to build people up instead of tearing them down.Through apologies, hard conversations, and moments of laughter, Christopher learns what it means to stand up for the people he loves ‚Äî and Buck learns that even painful moments can lead to deeper love, understanding, and pride in the family they‚Äôve built together.

entry.title: your will and mine (we belong together)
entry.summary:
Author: super_powerful_queen_slayyna

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,184Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 84

Summary: "Yeah, and I suppose it's normal to glare angrily at nothing in particular for no reason."Hen turned that glare on Chim. Chim stared right back, unintimidated."Fine," Hen huffed out. "It's about my Will.""Y-your Will?" Buck asked, surprised. He felt Eddie's arm land on his shoulder, using it for support as he leaned in with interest."The very one. The Last Will and Testament of Henrietta Wilson.""O-okay, what about it?""My family got some opinions."OREddie and Buck finally finish the conversation that started four years ago.

Author: rizcriz

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,396Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 98

Summary: That‚Äôs the problem.He thinks.He thinks, I love you, every morning he wakes up and finds Buck making breakfast.He thinks, I‚Äôm in love with you, every time Buck grins at him at the dinner table at the fire station, a quip on the tip of his tongue and a blush high on his cheeks.He thinks, I don‚Äôt want my life without you in it, just like this, forever, when Buck‚Äôs sitting on their couch in the hours after Chris has gone to sleep, and exhaustion claws at Eddie‚Äôs skin, begging him to follow in his wake. But Buck‚Äôs looking at listings, Buck‚Äôs looking at listings and their time is limited, and Eddie‚ÄîEddie thinks.Eddie thinks and thinks and thinks every little thing that matters; every momentous thought that at once feels stifling and freeing in the same fleeting moment.He thinks, endlessly.And, hauntingly‚ÄîHe thinks Buck straight into her arms.--Or, Buck's new relationship is moving too fast and Eddie's not sure how to stop it.

entry.title: Beneath the Twinkling Stars
entry.summary:
Author: Mooeyeddie (mooeyeddie)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 58,355Chapters: 8/12Kudos: 210

Summary: Between viewings, Buck finds himself lingering in the quiet moments, the spaces between rushing from one open house to another. Sitting in the Jeep, engine idling, he watches Eddie frowning at the radio as he struggles to connect to the aux, catching Chris‚Äôs reflection as he fills Buck and Eddie in on the ever-changing social dynamics of his DnD group. His chest tightens with the thought about what he‚Äôs leaving behind.He thinks of mornings in the South Bedford house, Eddie making coffee in his kitchen with the old, outdated machine he still insists on using despite its tendency to burn the grounds, Chris half-asleep at the table as he blearily spoons cereal into his mouth, glasses askew and hair mussed, and Buck feeling like he belongs. Like he‚Äôs stitched into the fabric of their lives.orEddie sabotages apartment viewings, Buck becomes a dad, and Chris is a teenager.Updates on Tuesdays üíï

entry.title: Between his hands - Part. 6 - Submission
entry.summary:
Author: 911_by_Jane

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,531Chapters: 2/5Kudos: 26

Summary: Where secrets, fears, and unexpected desires shatter the delicate balance of their relationship.After the ordeals that nearly cost him his life, Buck has managed to rebuild himself. His body has healed, his certification is validated, and Eddie's love has given him the strength to get back on his feet. But a persistent pain forces him to seek a medical opinion, and the ensuing revelations shake his entire world.Buck finds himself facing a choice that confronts his deepest fears. He believes he must give up his old life, Eddie's love, everything he has built. But Eddie, more determined than ever, won't let him go. He wants the world with him, and he is ready to do anything to convince him that their future has just begun.Will Buck be able to accept being loved for who he is, and embrace this new, unexpected life, filled with doubts, joy, and fears?I'm not very good to English, so please forgive any mistakes I didn't spot (there may be a lot.)

entry.title: What Came Spilling Out That Day (Was The Truth)
entry.summary:
Author: madame_bingo

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,053Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 65

Summary: God, Eddie was glad he wasn't here. He was glad that if anyone had to be on this plane that it was him and not Buck, or Bobby, or Chim, or Hen. But especially not Buck. Buck, who in less than 24 hours was going to have to explain to Christopher what had happened. Who in less than an hour was going to be his son‚Äôs legal guardian and he wouldn't even know it. Buck, who was expecting a call soon.¬†or¬†When Eddie's plane goes down, he leaves Buck a voicemail telling him how he feels, after all, he was about to die. Only he didn't die. And when he returns, Buck doesn't say anything about the voicemail and Eddie assumes that mean Buck just isn't interested.
